resources.string: Remote control for DACP-compatible desktop music players, like iTunes
Are you sure you want to forget all libraries ever paired with?
Your Android device is now in pairing mode, and should appear in your desktop/laptop media player. You'll need to enter a 4-digit code to finish the pairing process:
After entering the code on your desktop/laptop, this window should disappear. If you get stuck, just tap the back button to cancel.
TunesRemote helps you remote control your DACP-compatible desktop or laptop media player, such as Apple iTunes\u2122.
It lets you easily browse your albums, including full-text search from a distance.

Before we get started, we need to get some legal information out of the way:

TunesRemote provides its service to you subject to the following conditions. You accept these conditions by using TunesRemote.

This program and all information, content, materials, products and services included are provided by TunesRemote on an 'as is' basis without warranties or conditions of any kind.

Neither TunesRemote nor its author will not be liable for any damages of any kind arising from the use of this program or from any information, content, materials, products or services made available through this program.

iTunes is a registered trademark of Apple, Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries. This program makes no claim to be either authorized or approved by Apple, Inc.
Open iTunes and make sure you're on the same Wifi network. If having trouble, try cycling your Wifi, opening port 3689 in your firewall, or tapping Menu and Refresh.
